meanings.definition: Resembling a tree in structure, especially in having branches or branches like extensions.
meanings.sent1: The dendritic pattern of the river branches was beautiful to see.
meanings.sent2: The dendritic snowflakes fell gently from the sky.
meanings.sent3: The dendritic cracks on the sidewalk looked like tiny tree roots.
meanings.sent4: Her dendritic thoughts spread out in all directions, like the branches of a tree.
meanings.sent5: The dendritic lightning streaked across the sky, illuminating the night.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a dendrite.
meanings.sent1: The dendritic connection between the neurons was crucial for transmitting signals.
meanings.sent2: The dendritic structure of the nerve cells allowed for efficient communication.
meanings.sent3: The dendritic dance of the neurons was like a synchronized ballet.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a dendritic network, each thought a branching pathway.
meanings.sent5: The dendritic growth of the nerve endings was a marvel of nature.

meanings.sent1: The dendritic coral reef provided shelter for many sea creatures.
meanings.sent2: The dendritic pattern of the frost on the window was intricate.
meanings.sent3: The dendritic shadows of the trees stretched across the path.
meanings.sent4: His dendritic map of ideas led him to new discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The dendritic veins in the leaf spread out like tiny rivers.
